author: Carrie Buck’s assailant
title: Lost Boy Diary Fragment
text: The world is too loud. I walk home and feel like everyone is looking at me. I think if I could be quiet forever, maybe I could disappear. I keep hearing the same thought: ‘You are wrong. You don’t belong.’ I don’t tell anyone because nobody would understand.

author: Elias Abuelazam
title: notebook entry
text: I feel like I am standing outside my own life. Nobody talks to me. Nobody sees me unless I force them to. Every day I wake up and think: today I will matter.

author: Brenda Spencer
title: school assignment
text: I feel trapped in my house. It’s like the world is locked outside and I can’t get out. Everything feels flat and pointless. I wish something would happen.

author: Jeffrey Dahmer
title: various records
text:
I feel like there is a black cloud over me all the time.
I try to say what’s going on but the words don’t come out right.
People think I’m quiet but my mind is loud and confused.

author: Jeffrey Dahmer
title: various records
text:
I sometimes feel like I am not part of anything.
People smile at me and I smile back, but it feels like acting.
I try to be normal, but it doesn’t last.

author: Jeffrey Dahmer
title: various records
text:
I love watching the sunset. It’s peaceful.
I like reading comic books and imagining stories.
Sometimes I laugh with friends about silly things; it makes the day better.

author: Dorothea Puente
title: letter
text:
I have to be careful who I let around me.
People are not what they seem.
I feel I must manage everything myself to avoid trouble.

author: Cesare Battisti
title: letters before capture
text:
I am tired.

I do not know how long one can live hunted.
A man wishes for quiet more than anything.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
title: notes from the house of the dead
text:
The barracks are cold.
We wake before dawn.
I watched the men work today. Some talked, some were silent.
I could not tell which were more unhappy.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
title: notes from the house of the dead
text:
Suffering is a flame
That burns without consuming.

You do not become ashes—
You become transparent

author: Pierre-François Lacenaire
title: Personal Notes
text:
I live outside the law because the law never lived for me.
I do not seek pity.
I only want to explain myself, for I feel misunderstood even by myself.
